title: Commentary on Jordan Peterson Biblical Series 3c Biblical Literalism
description:
Peterson notes non-literal interpretation by Origen of Alexandria who in many ways set up European allegorical interpretation. But why does "literalism" keep coming into the conversation? What does it mean? Why do we care so much about the Bible and history? 

Biblical Series 3 https://youtu.be/R_GPAl_q2QQ 

Jordan Levine's Transliminal 2015 https://youtu.be/07Ys4tQPRis (Levine's Patreon page https://www.patreon.com/transliminal)  

NT Wright review of Bentley Hart's NT https://www.christiancentury.org/review/books/new-testament-strange-words-david-bentley-hart 

Unbelievable with Richard Dawkins https://youtu.be/p5_0Fx_RICI 

William Jennings Bryan http://www.pbs.org/godinamerica/people/william-jennings-bryan.html 

131 Christians Everyone Should Know https://www.amazon.com/Christians-Everyone-Should-Holman-Reference/dp/B004HIM27K 

http://www.christianitytoday.com/history/people/scholarsandscientists/origen.html

Phillip Cary Philosophy and Religion in the West https://www.audible.com/pd/Religion-Spirituality/Philosophy-and-Religion-in-the-West-Audiobook/B00DEQQO9I
